      • editPart

        public void editPart(Form article,
                     org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier identifier)
              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Changes the information of the part, such as name, description, price, weight colours, categories.
        Parameters:
        article - The form containing information like the new name,description,colours and categories for the edited article.
        identifier - The ProductIdentifier of the article,which will be edited.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the article is not present in the catalog.

      • editComposite

                          CompositeForm form,
                          java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> partsCount)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Changes the information of the Composite, such as name, description, included articles.
        Parameters:
        form - The form containing information like the new name and description.
        identifier - The ProductIdentifier of the article,which will be edited.
        partsCount - The user's input which articles and how many of them are included in the Composite.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the article is not present in the catalog.

      • getArticlesForCompositeEdit

        public java.util.Map<Article,java.lang.Integer> getArticlesForCompositeEdit(org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier identifier)
        Returns all Articles that are not already included in another Composite or included in the given Composite.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The ProductIdentifier of the Composite that will be edited.
        Returns:
        Map of all articles that are already included in the Composite and how often or available to include in the Composite.

      • maximumOrderAmount

        public int maximumOrderAmount(org.salespointframework.catalog.ProductIdentifier identifier)
        Returns the number of units in stock of the given Article.
        Parameters:
        identifier - The ProductIdentifier of the Article.
        Returns:
        How many units of the article you can buy at the same time, depending on how many units are in stock right now.
